numlitem.para: L and R hydraulic low SYS PRESS lights are operative, and
Normal and alternate brake systems and brake accumulator are verified to be operative.

placard.para: Placard Brake Source light "LIGHT INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Brake Source Light
maintenance.para: Check that normal and alternate hydraulic brake systems, and brake accumulator are operational:

numlitem.para: Check that landing gear ground lock pins are installed (Ref. Maintenance Manual 32-00-20) and wheels are adequately chocked.
Release parking brakes by depressing both Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals to the stops and releasing.
Pressurize the right hydraulic system with one electric pump, observe R SYS PRESS light is not illuminated.
Depress and release both Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals seven times minimum. Brake pressure gauges should dip momentarily (2000 to 2500 psi) at each brake application.

note.para: Both brake pedals should be depressed and released at the same time. Pause a minimum of five seconds after each brake application before the next application.

numlitem.para: Check that BRAKE PRESS pressure gauge on First Officer's main instrument panel P3 indicates 2850 to 3500 psig.
Pressurize the left hydraulic system with one electric pump, observe L SYS PRESS light is not illuminated.
Depressurize the right hydraulic system, observe R SYS PRESS light illuminates.
Depress and release both Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals seven times minimum. Observe that brake pressure gauge does not dip with brake application.
Check the BRAKE PRESS pressure gauge on P3 panel indicates 2850 to 3500 psig.
Depress and release both Captain's or First Officer's brake pedals seven times minimum.
Check that BRAKE PRESS pressure gauge on P3 panel indicates a lower value each time the brakes are applied. Final pressure should be about 1150 - 1500 psig.
Ensure brake accumulator is correctly serviced.
Restore aircraft to its required configuration.
